column4: I do a  sudo loadkeys fi-latin1, but and get a Loading echo, but still have the same layout.
How do I change my keyboard layout?
gxine, Jivenix.
vlc, I'd say.
videolanclient, jivenix. It's in the repositories.
What config ought I edit to change my keyboard layout?
for X or text mode?
for X.
where's xorg.conf again?
/etc/X11/xorg.conf
This is freaky. I can apparently change to some keyboards without a bother, but when I attempt to go to the Finnish one, it throws me through desktop themes.
Thanks, both of you.
there's a known bug that does that when you choose keyboard maps
all right, but it doesn't do that when I change to a map that works.
(there's also an entry in bugzilla that links to a couple of .debs that (try to) fix it)
i see
and it gives me the message.. The loading of the image gnome-fs-home failed
Details: icon not found.
Maybe, freakishly enough, there's a bit lacking in one of my themes, and if I fix that, I can change keyboard layouts again :p
i don't remember seeing that msg - just gnome/gkt2 theme freaking out for a couple of sec
that's not the exact wording, but translated.
